prop_obj.text: The aims of the syllabus are to test:
(1) candidates’ knoweldge and understanding of the basic concepts of Information and
(2) the capabilities of candidates in the application of ICT knowledge in education and business.

There will be two papers, Papers 1 and 2 both of which will be a composite paper to be
PAPER 1: Will consist of forty multiple-choice objective questions all of which must be
PAPER 2: Will consist of four compulsory test of practical knowledge questions, and six

data.preamble:
There will be two papers, Papers 1 and 2 both of which will be a composite paper to be taken at one sitting.

PAPER 1: Will consist of forty multiple-choice objective questions all of which must be answered within 45 minutes for 20 marks.

PAPER 2: Will consist of four compulsory test of practical knowledge questions, and six essay-type questions.  Candidates will be required to answer  the compulsory test of practical questions and any two of the other questions within 2 hours  for 80 marks.

data.preamble:
1   INTRODUCTION 1.1 Meaning of ICT and its related TO BASIC ICT terminologies. CONCEPTS AND 1.2         Uses of ICT tools e.g.mobile phones, COMPUTERS computers, Internet, television set, 2 COMPUTER 2.1  Categories of computer hardware: HARDWARE system unit, peripherals and storage 3  COMPUTER 3.1  Types of software: 3  COMPUTER 3.1  Types of software: SOFTWARE System and application software.

3.2 Open source and proprietary software.

4   THREATS TO 4.1 Meaning of computer threats. COMPUTERS 4.2 Categories of computer threats. AND USERS 4.2.1    Natural threats e.g. earth-quakes, heat, floods, etc.

4.2.2 Human threats e.g.viruses, worms, intentional

damage, etc.

4.3 Health hazards to computer users: causes and effects.

4.4 Remedies to threats and hazards.

5   WORD PROCESSING 5.1 Word Processing packages, their importance.

5.2  Related concepts and terminologies

5.3  Creating and saving documents.

5.4  Editing, formatting and insertion of

graphics, etc.

5.5  Printing of documents.

5.6  Speed and Accuracy in typing at

6   SPREADSHEET 6.1  Spreadsheet packages, their uses and importance.

6.2  Related concepts and terminologies

6.3  Types of data and their uses.

6.4  Creating and saving workbook.

6.5  Constructing and inserting formulae

7   PRESENTATION 7.1  Presentation Packages, uses and importance.

7.2  Creating and saving presentations.

7.3  Editing, formatting and insertion of objects.

7.4  Slide shows.

7.5 Master slides.

7.6 Factors to consider before delivering

8   THE INTERNET 8.1 Meaning, concepts, terminologies requirements.

8.2    Features and uses of browser windows.

8.3    Rules and regulations in the use of the Internet (Netiquette).

8.4    Sending and accessing e-mail.

8.5    Internet related tools for communication, e.g. chatting, downloading, uploading, search engines, facebook, etc.
